National Vocations Awareness Week Daylight Savings Time ends Wis 1122122 2 Thes 11122 Lk 19110 THIRTIETH SUNDAY IN ORDINARY TIME October 27 2019 As a reminder this Friday November 1st is a Holy Day of Obliga tion celebrating the Solemnity of All Saints On this day we rejoice with the Church Triumphant Those men and women who have lived lives in imitation of our Lord Jesus Christ and are now united with Him in Heaven for all eter nity The love of God is so strong that even death itself cannot separate us from Jesus Christ Romans 83839 This also means that even death cannot separate us from our brothers and sisters in the Lord as we are all members of His Body which is the Church The Saints have become that great cloud of witnesses Hebrews 121 that we join with through the Holy Sacrifice of the Mass in worship of God Through their witness they point us to Jesus through their intercession they aide us in growing in our relationship with Him To celebrate the Solemnity of All Saints we will offer a vigil Mass on Thursday Oct 31st at 7 PM and Masses on Friday Nov 1st at both 7 AM and 5:30PM incense may be used at this Mass Following our 5:30PM Mass on Friday Nov 1st all are invited to join us in continuing our celebration in the Parish Social Hall for our Annual All Saints Day Party Please signup in the Narthex or call the Parish Office if you plan to attend Reminder Our children and adults are invited to dress up as their favorite Saint and join in a procession at the beginning of the 5:30PM Mass Please arrive by 5:20PM to join the procession On Saturday November 2nd we commemorate All Souls Day Hav ing celebrated the lives of those in Heaven we now pray for those who are undergoing purgation and being cleansed of all worldly imperfections 1 Co rinthians 31115 as they prepare for complete enjoyment of life with God in Christ Purgatory a state of postmortem purification exists and it is of benefit to those souls who are experiencing purification that we remember them in prayer 2 Maccabees 123946 particularly at the Sacrifice of the Holy Mass To put it another way just as we can pray for someones struggles in this life we can surely do the same for them after death as we remain con nected to one another through Jesus Christ For the Commemoration of All Souls Day we will offer Masses on Saturday Nov 2nd at 8 AM and Noon Note The Noon Mass will be a Requiem Low Mass offered in the Extraordinary Form meaning the prayers will be prayed in Latin Missalettes will be provided with LatinEnglish translations for the Noon Mass Throughout the entire month of November we are called to remem ber and pray for all those who have died which is a spiritual work of mercy We will continue our tradition of placing memorial candles alongside the stat ues of the Blessed Virgin and St Joseph in memory of our loved ones who are no longer with us Please contact the Parish Office if you wish to partici pate in this beautiful tradition or if you have memorial candles from past years please return them to the Parish Office by Wednesday Oct 30th You are also invited to inscribe the names of lost loved ones in our parishs Book of Prayer Intentions located in the narthex When entering the Church Id encour age you to look at the names inscribed and in your kindness offer a prayer for the repose of the souls of all the faithful departed Faithfully in Christ Fr David WEEKEND OF NOVEMBER 23 2019 CANTORS 500 Larry Leitz 730 Donna Geisel 1000 Nichole Decker LECTORS 500 Knights of Columbus 730 Carol Butler 1000 Monica Harris EUCHARISTIC MINISTERS CORNER As we enter heaven we will see them so many of them coming towards us and thanking us We will ask who they are and they will say a poor soul you prayed for in purgatory Ven Fulton Sheen winter and enjoy breakfast on the Knights Bishop Luers High School Open House Thursday November 7 2019 from 6:30pm 8:30pm For Information or questions please call Jenny Andorfer at (260)456-1261 ext 3139 Space still remains for the Diocese of Fort WayneSouth Bend high school pilgrimage to the national March for Life in Washington DC from Jan 2326 2020 Students can register to at tend with a parish group or through their Catholic high school Some of the highlights include participating in the March for Life a diocesan Mass with Bishop Kevin Rhoades at the National Shrine of the Immaculate Conception as well as a visit to our seminarians at Mount St Marys Seminary Registration can be found online www.fwsbm.com To sign up for the All Saints Day Party so we know how many to prepare for
